page.title: 07Welland - Village
page.content: The village of{Welland}is situated on the crossroads of the A41O4 and the B42O8. The Pheasant Inn is marked on old maps of the area; the church of St James was consecrated in 1876 (the original church was a mile to the East) and the growth of the village dates from this time. The primary school opened in the same year and in September 1985 had 99 pupils (expected to rise to 12O by July 1986). The original buildings were mainly farms and agricultural cottages but these have been joined by more modern houses. {The population of the village {has doubled since 198O}with the construcion of 3 new housing estates. There is a large village hall with a recreation ground behind, a thriving village shop and a couple of garages. There is no street lighting or gas supply.
